results.title: People over the Plenty
results.brief_description: The film follows the reconstruction of the Greensborough footbridge after the original cable suspension bridge was swept away in the River Plenty floods of 1974. The Shire of Diamond Valley contracted B.C.S. Consulting Engineers and Surveyors and Gibbs Bright & Co, timber suppliers to rebuild the bridge. The Greensborough Bridge is unique in that it is the first structure of its kind to be made of pine, is the longest footbridge in Australia and was aesthetically designed to blend in perfect harmony with its rural surroundings.

results.title: People into Politics (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The theme of this program is how people in three cities Birmingham, Cracow and Vancouver, become involved in a variety of urban political movements.

results.title: People are different
results.brief_description: Made during one term’s evening classes at a London County Council institute. It shows how differently, in learning to paint, people approach the same subject; how differently they handle materials; and how, having gained confidence in themselves, they are able to work effectively on group painting.

results.title: People's palace
results.brief_description: A tour of Hampton Court Palace, which has been open to the public for over a century. Visitors are seen relaxing in this pleasant and historic setting, buying grapes from the ancient Great Vine, watching “real tennis” on the original court and viewing a 400-year old astronomical clock. We see something of the events associated with the Guard Room, the Haunted Gallery, the Chapel Royal and the Great Hall.

results.title: People's march for jobs
results.brief_description: This film is about the people’s march for jobs held in May 1981 from Liverpool to London. The march was a response to the wastage of unemployment in Britain.

results.title: People's holiday
results.brief_description: Danish law provides that every worker in Demark is entitled to annual holidays in summer. Trades Unions and Workers Cooperatives have established Folk Ferie, an organization which arranges holidays and maintains youth hostels and beach holiday towns. Other activities include the provision of farm holidays for city industrial workers and the arrangement of international holidays.

results.title: Penny and Ann
results.brief_description: Penny, aged about 18, is partially blind and has been attending the Lethbridge Rehabilitation Centre where Ann, her occupational therapist, works on a programme of activities for daily living.

results.title: Penance: Sacrament of peace
results.creator_credit: Bruce Bailer and Franciscan Communications Centre
results.brief_description: A dramatisation illustrating the universal story of sin, repentance, reconciliation and peace. Ray Hendricks, driving home from a cocktail party, accidentally strikes a little girl. He tries to cover up his guilt and remorse by attempting to convince himself and others that because he was cleared by the police, he is not guilty of anything. He finally risks the confrontation and visits the little girl. She gives him sympathy because he looks hurt, and her naive assumption of this basic goodness brings him peace.

results.title: Pelican Island
results.brief_description: Down south in Florida where Ponde De Leon ages ago sought the spring of eternal youth, there is a queer island inhabited by pelicans. Burlington studies the map to see how the pelican get there.

results.title: Peace is more than a dream....
results.creator_credit: Trudy Van Keulne, CVK Television and IKOR
results.brief_description: Through the children themselves and their drawings, this film tells the story of 250,000 Palestinian refugee children working for peace in their homeland.
